Friday 17th October

1pm – 4.30pm

[/vc_column_text][vc_video link=”https://youtu.be/LGdp47szmnE?si=gHWp8LXCw7OvrkoV” css=””][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1756913414843{margin-top: 30px !important;margin-bottom: 30px !important;}” text_direction=”default”]Discover how artificial intelligence is reshaping industries and influencing your professional journey. This session offers practical insights into AI’s evolving role in business, regulation, and innovation – empowering participants to engage with AI confidently and responsibly.

Key themes:
1. Discover how  AI is redefining how industries operate, offering new tools, and efficiencies for you to harness.
2. Understand how global approaches to AI governance help you navigate compliance and innovation.
3. Explore common challenges in AI uptake and how to overcome them.
4. Find out whyAI is not just a tool—it’s an opportunity for you  to lead, create, and shape the future.
5. Navigate the complexity of AI’s immense potential, alongside questions about transparency, accountability and long-term societal impact. Discuss not just what AI can do, but what it should do.

column_border_width=”none” column_border_style=”solid”][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Francisco Martinez-Garcia

Chief Inclusion Officer and Head of Total Rewards, Moody’s

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Francisco Martinez-Garcia became Moody’s Chief Inclusion Officer in January 2023, leading efforts to foster a culture of inclusion. In 2025, he also took on the role of Head of Total Rewards, overseeing global compensation, benefits, and recognition. Since joining Moody’s in 2019 to lead Global Compensation, he expanded his remit to include Global People Business Partners and later served as MD-Global People Business Partner for MIS, TSG, and ESG. Prior to Moody’s, Francisco spent over 15 years at Colgate-Palmolive in global and regional roles across the U.S., Mexico, and Switzerland. He holds Master’s degrees from Cornell and Arizona State, and a Bachelor’s in Economics from la Universidad Autónoma de Nuevo León.

text_direction=”default”]

Dina Baïche

Director, Solutions Specialist, Moody’s

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Dina Baïche is an Associate Director and Program Manager at Moody’s Analytics, where she plays a key role in driving innovation and strategic initiatives within the financial services sector. She has been featured as a speaker at major industry events, including the Moody’s European Banking Roadshow in Paris, where she led a breakout session on AI use cases in banking, highlighting the transformative potential of artificial intelligence in areas such as loan monitoring, credit memo automation, and onboarding risk assessment. Her work focuses on integrating advanced technologies like generative AI into financial workflows to enhance decision-making, streamline operations, and improve risk management.

text_direction=”default”]

Kukua Darko-Samaroo

Director, Customer Success Management, Moody’s

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Director in Customer Success Management, Kukua works to create a premier client experience for Moody’s high value accounts in order to deepen customer loyalty.  Her role serves to act as a bridge between the product team and high value clients, as well as promoting key content from the Rating Agency through client roundtables and encouraging event participation. The team also works hard to bring clients into the product development process via prototype testing and feedback meetings.

Kukua previously worked in Pricing with the Global Head of Value Proposition and Market Strategy for 9 years within the Commercial Group (MIS). She has also been an active steering committee member of both the Multicultural BRG and the Black Impact Group.

text_direction=”default”]

Stefan Taylor

Senior Analyst – Pricing, Moody’s Ratings

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Stefan is a Senior Analyst in Moody’s Commercial Group, where he is recognized for his ability to bridge commercial and pricing teams, through advising on complex pricing structures and supporting global relationship management efforts. Stefan contributes to strategic client engagement, while delivering commercial insights across diverse industries. Known for his collaborative leadership and inclusive approach, he supports initiatives in pricing strategy, provides training, and drives global process enhancements.

With experience spanning asset management and fintech, Stefan brings expertise in capital markets, UK financial regulations, and financial instruments, backed by advanced skills in Bloomberg, Salesforce, and Excel.

Stefan holds a first-class degree in Banking and Finance and an Investment Operations Certificate with the Chartered Institute of Securities and Investments. He is passionate about equity in finance and actively contributes to the Black Impact BRG at Moody’s.

text_direction=”default”]

Florence Henderson

AVP- Inclusion, Moody’s

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column_inner][/vc_row_inner][vc_column_text css=”” text_direction=”default”]

Florence Henderson currently serves as AVP, EMEA Inclusion Lead at Moody’s based in London where she has responsibility for implementing Moody’s global Inclusion strategy at a regional level. Florence’s responsibilities also include senior stakeholder management, project management, coordinating Business Resource Groups (BRGs), communications, and oversight of improvements in benchmarking and advancement of Moody’s Inclusion goals. Prior to her current role which she joined in December 2020, Florence previously held multiple roles at Moody’s, including HR Project Manager.  Florence previously worked at S&P Global, where she held various roles over 20 years, including eight years in product management and marketing.
